body:
If a question in your existing test shows a leaked question indicator, you can replace it with a new question with the Replace question functionality.

To know more about Leaked questions, see the article Managing Leaked Questions.

  1. Click on the Leaked Question Indicator beside the question name.
  2. On the following screen, you can see the source where the question is leaked.
  3. To replace that question, click Replace Question.
  4. You are now redirected to the HackerRank Library page. The replace question functionality automatically places the filters such as skills, question type, difficulty level, recommended time, and score.
  5. You can select the question and click Replace.
  6. On the following screen, you can view the comparison between the existing leaked question and the new question that will replace it.
  7. Click Confirm to replace the question in your test.
  8. Once you replace the question, the test will be moved to draft mode. You must publish the test again to use it.Â
title: Leaked Questions Indicator
